dt: {bc}a plaintiff's reply to a defendant's plea, answer, or counterclaim
{bc}the action or process of reproducing or duplicating
{bc}performance of an experiment or procedure more than once

et: Middle English {it}replicacioun{/it} "answer, rejoinder, argument, repetition," borrowed from Anglo-French & Late Latin; Anglo-French {it}replicacion{/it} "answer to an argument or statement of an opponent," borrowed from Late Latin {it}replicātiōn-, replicātiō{/it} "act of bending or folding, repetition, reply, replication in court," going back to Latin, "contrary rotation, replication," from {it}replicāre{/it} "to turn back on itself, bend back, go over (a thought, topic) repeatedly, make a replication" (Late Latin also "to restore, repeat, reply") + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action {ma}{mat|replicate:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: an answer to a reply : rejoinder
a plaintiff's reply to a defendant's plea, answer, or counterclaim
